Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the analysis of the mud sample.
Column Comment.1: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.2: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the analysis of the sample.
Column Comment.3: MUD ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: A Unique observation number for themud analysis.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: CIRCULATION STOP DATE: Date the drilling circulation stopped prior to conductingthe wireline log operation.
Column Comment.6: CIRCULATION STOP TIME: Time when the mud circulation stopped prior toconducting the wireline log survey.
Column Comment.7: CIRCULATION STOP TIMEZONE: Timezone of CIRCULATION STOP TIME.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: FLUID FLOW: The measured fluid flow at the time the sample was collected.
Column Comment.12: FLUID LOSS: Amount of drilling fluid lost to liquid filtration after 30 minutes.
Column Comment.13: MUD FLUID LOSS OUOM: Mud fluid loss original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: MUD COLLECTION REASON: the reason or business process behind the collectionof the mud sample, such as logging or drilling.
Column Comment.15: MUD DENSITY: Value for the mass per unit volume of the drilling fluid/mud for thewireline logging run.
Column Comment.16: MUD DENSITY OUOM: Mud density original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: MUD PH: Value of the drilling mud pH, acidity or alkalinity. Can range between 0 to14 pH units.
Column Comment.20: MUD SAMPLE TYPE: The type of mud sample used in determining mud resistivity.For example mud cake, filtrate, mud...
Column Comment.21: DRILLING MEDIA: Identifies the various drilling media type present in a wellbore.Commonly referred to as MUD TYPE. For example chemical gel mud, crude oil ornative mud.
Column Comment.22: MUD VISCOSITY: Value of the funnel viscosity, defined by the number of seconds ittakes 1 quart of drilling fluid to flow through the Marsh funnel.
Column Comment.23: MUD VISCOSITY OUOM: Mud viscosity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.24: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.25: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.26: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not the well mud sampleis preferred for the analysis.
Column Comment.27: PROBLEM INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not there is a problem withthe step. If a yes flag is indicated, additional information regarding the problemshould be noted in the table ANL_PROBLEM.
Column Comment.28: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.29: SAMPLE DATE: The date this this sample was collected.
Column Comment.30: SAMPLE DEPTH: The measured depth at which this sample was collected
Column Comment.32: SAMPLE TIME: The time when the sample was collected.
Column Comment.33: SAMPLE TIMEZONE: Timezone of SAMPLE TIME.
Column Comment.34: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.35: SOURCE LOCATION: Location where the mud sample was taken.
Column Comment.36: TIME SINCE CIRCULATION: Value for the elapsed time from the stopped circulationprocess to the start of the wireline log survey.
Column Comment.37: TIME SINCE CIRCULATION OUOM: Time since circulation original unit of measure.
Column Comment.38: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.40: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.42: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.45: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
